title: Warhammer 40,000: Sanctus Reach
notes: "Failed to create device for rendering. Invalid resolution, or cannot run without at least shader model 3.0 (0)". Works on same system booted to Windows 10
specs: AMD Phenom II X4 965 / GeForce GTX 960

gpu: Intel Open Source Technology Center Mesa DRI Intel(R) Haswell Mobile x86/MMX/SSE2
title: Warhammer 40,000: Sanctus Reach

notes: Initially game crashed with The launcher starts but the games crashes. "Failed to create device for rendering. Invalid resolution or cannot run without at least shader model 3.0 (0)'. To fix that one need to apply fix described in https://forum.winehq.org/viewtopic.php?f=8&t=30764 1. Go to <steam-library</steamapps/compatdata/502370/pfx/drive_c/users/steamuser/My Documents/My Games/SANCTUS. Open OPTIONS.TXT. 3. Change RezX to your horizontal resolution (mine is RezX 1920). 4. Change RezY to your vertical resolution (mine is RezX 1080). 5. Change Fullscreen to 0. After that the game can be run. I hadn't observed any issues, although it was my first play ever. If you don't find an OPTIONS.TXT where it should be, just create it and paste in the content from here: https://pastebin.com/RzYeqSCN. This fix seems to work for many Slitherine made wargames.
title: Warhammer 40,000: Sanctus Reach

notes: Crashes after Video. Message: ""Failed to create device for rendering. Invalid resolution, or cannot run without at least shader model 3.0 (0)". Works on same system booted to Windows 10"
